intro: Pavetta gamblei, commonly known as the African pavetta, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and often have a slightly waxy texture. The flowers are small, clustered in umbels, and typically have five petals, with colors ranging from white to pink.
